name: entryway
content:

a way into a place; an entrance: The doors were an entryway to a basement area. See also
entry
an inside area through which you enter a building or that leads to other rooms within a building: They stood in the home's entryway with its tall ceilings and dramatic arched windows. Synonyms
hall
hallway
a way to get into something or start to be involved in something: entryway into Trojan horses can create an entryway into your computer for malevolent users. The typewriter changed business processes and provided an entryway for women into the male-dominated workplace.
More examplesFewer examplesYou may have friends and relatives who like to visit and need accessible entryways. Old, broken-down fences and furniture were visible through the entryway.Inside the church's entryway are writings that appear to be in Arabic.An octagonal overlook on the second floor (rimmed with an iron railing) offers a dramatic view of the entryway beneath.We don't know whether this is a passing fad or if it's an entryway into an addiction.Interested adults can also find an entryway into biotech at community colleges.
